diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,47 @@

+# limitations under the License.
+# ==============================================================================
+include (ExternalProject)
+
+set(snappy_URL https://github.com/google/snappy.git)
+set(snappy_TAG "1.1.6")
+set(snappy_BUILD ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/snappy/src/snappy)
+set(snappy_INCLUDE_DIR ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/snappy/src/snappy)
+
+if(WIN32)
+    set(snappy_STATIC_LIBRARIES ${snappy_BUILD}/$(Configuration)/snappy.lib)
+endif()
body:
Apparently, SNAPPY CMake build does not offer static library option, so I used the shared library instead. Should work, I guess.
I could not verify it completely on Linux because in the latest master CMake build fails somewhere in the middle for a completely unrelated reason. But the change should be alright.
